test

Class Series.TestState

  • java.lang.Object
    • test.Series.TestState
  • Enclosing class:
    Series

    static class Series.TestState
extends Object
    Individual test state.

    This class contains fields that indicate whether the test object has been constructed, whether the test has been stopped, whether cleanup has been completed, and the causes of any failures that occurred.

    These fields cannot be placed in Test because test objects come into existence only after the test is started. In fact, it is possible for a test to stop before the test object has even been created - for example, in case timeout occurs while the constructor is still running.

    It is also not advisable to place these fields directly in Series, because it is not in general possible to guarantee that all the threads started by one test have terminated before another test starts running. Because of this, it is possible that one test's delayed thread will call Test.success or Test.failure after the next test has started. In that case, if the fields affected by that call were in Series and shared between all tests, the delayed thread from the old test would terminate the next test.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) Throwable cause
      If the thread was stopped by a failure, this is the cause.
      (package private) FatalError cleanup_stop_cause
      If cleanup failed, this is the cause.
      (package private) boolean cleanup_stopped
      Flag set when cleanup has stopped.
      (package private) boolean initialize_stopped
      Flag set if the initialize method has completed.
      (package private) boolean stopped
      Flag set if the test has stopped.
      (package private) String task
      Current task message.
      (package private) Test test
      Test object, if it has been created.

    • Field Detail

      • test

        Test test
        Test object, if it has been created.

      • initialize_stopped

        boolean initialize_stopped
        Flag set if the initialize method has completed. The thread calling clean will not proceed until this is set.

      • stopped

        boolean stopped
        Flag set if the test has stopped. This occurs after a call to success or failure, or due to timeout.

      • cause

        Throwable cause
        If the thread was stopped by a failure, this is the cause.

      • cleanup_stopped

        boolean cleanup_stopped
        Flag set when cleanup has stopped.

      • cleanup_stop_cause

        FatalError cleanup_stop_cause
        If cleanup failed, this is the cause.

      • task

        String task
        Current task message. Regular (not cleanup) failures are wrapped in a FailedDuringTask object if they occur when this is not null.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Series.TestState

        Series.TestState()

    • Method Detail

      • stop

        void stop(Throwable cause)
        Stops the test.

        If this method has not yet been called for the current test, the stopped flag is set and any waiting threads are notified. If the method has alreay been called, calling it again has no effect.

        The test termination cause is set from the parameter. If the cause is null, the test is considered to have succeeded. Otherwise, the test failed. Test.success calls this method with null as argument, and Test.failure calls this method and passes its argument.

        If the test is being stopped due to a failure, and there is a task message set when the failure occurrs, then the failure is wrapped in a FailedDuringTask object which stores the task message.

        Parameters:
        cause - If the test failed, the cause of the failure, or null if the test was successful.

      • stopCleanup

        void stopCleanup(FatalError cause)
        Stops test cleanup.

        This method may only be called after the test has stopped. Calling this method earlier will cause the test to be terminated with a fatal error.

        If the method has not yet been successfully called, the cleanup process is stopped. The cleanup_stopped flag is set and any waiting threads are notified. If the method has already been successfully called, calling it again has no effect.

        The Test.cleanupSuccess and Test.cleanupFailure call this method.

        Parameters:
        cause - If cleanup failed, the cause of the failure, or null if cleanup was successful.

      • task

        void task(String description)
        Sets the current task message.
        Parameters:
        description - Description of the current task.
